clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Return to Work Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Inpatient-return- To-work, Multicomponent, Rehabilitation Programs for Persons Temporary Out of Work With Musculoskeletal-, Unspecific-, and/or Common Mental Health Disorders; Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: Long-term sick-listing from work has considerable impact on social function, on the families of the sick-listed persons, the companies they work for, and society as a whole. Hence, the need for documented effective vocational rehabilitation programs is pressing. Vocational rehabilitation services described in the scientific literature have been specific to one single or a specific group of medical conditions (e.g.low back pain). In contrast, most people on sick leave have several health complaints, and many of the factors influencing sick leave are shared regardless of disorder (e.g. social surroundings, workplace environment), calling for rehabilitation programs that can be employed for both musculoskeletal-, unspecific- and common mental disorders. Aim of this study is to investigate whether a group based rehabilitation program for musculoskeletal, mental or unspecific complaints can facilitate return-to-work (RTW), thereby testing two multicomponent return-to-work RTW rehabilitation programs.

primary_outcome.description: return-to-work i.e. for at least 4 weeks without relapse

primary_outcome.measure: Total number of sickness absence days
primary_outcome.description: after enrollment in the study (i.e. after pre-screening)

secondary_outcome.description: Pain, depression, anxiety, and other subjective complaints

secondary_outcome.measure: physical, social and emotional functional status
Psychological and social factors at work

other_outcome.measure: Health economics from the societal perspective

arm_group.description: a 3.5-week, in-patient rehabilitation program, organized as a 7-hour workday with weekends off, simulating a close to normal summer work-week in Norway, and mainly group-based with maximum 8 participants per group. Focus on mental training (aimed at increasing motivation and self-efficacy), physical training and work-related problem solving.

4+4 full days of rehabilitation at Hysnes Rehabilitation Center, separated by 2 weeks living at home. Group-based with 8 participants per group, focus on mental training (aimed at increasing motivation and self-efficacy), physical training and work-related problem solving. A workplace visit will be included in addition to the 4 + 4 rehabilitation days, if considered relevant.

6 dynamic processes (committed action, self-as-context, presence in the moment, values, defusion and acceptance) are targeted both in group-sessions and individual meetings. Only the psychological part of the experimental interventions is applied, in an outpatient setting.
this group will be followed in registers at group level and not be aware of their participation in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- living in the counties of Tr√∏ndelag
- on sick leave 2-12 months
- current sick leave status of 50% - 100%
- ICPC-2 (International Classification of Primary Care, Second edition) diagnosis within the L (musculoskeletal), P (psychiatric) or A (unspecific disorders) categories
Exclusion Criteria:
- alcohol or drug abuse
- serious somatic or psychological disorders
- a specific disorder requiring specialized treatment
- pregnancy
- currently participating in another treatment program
- insufficient Norwegian speaking or writing skills to participate in group session and fill out questionnaires
- scheduled for surgery within the next 6 months
- serious problems with functioning in a group setting
